result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Plea/sentencing hearing on November 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
dated 10-24-2022, filed by Atty. Angela Wang requesting an earlier plea and sentencing date. **Reviewed by Judge Reilly - Court will set for a plea/sentencing**

10:42 AM Defendant Patrick A Walker in court, in custody.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Patrick A Walker.  Attorney Charles Hoffmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Matter set for status of counsel.  Defense requests another status date in about 30 days.
Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty. Wang as counsel of record for the defendant.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to have no contact with Waukesha Memorial Hospital (EXCEPTION: unless having an emergency) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

2:26 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant Patrick A Walker in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Patrick A Walker. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
